title: torch.nn.functional.nll_loss not returning negative log likelihood
body_html:
Issue description

torch.nn.functional.nll_loss returns the negative likelihood instead of the negative log likelihood.

Code example

import torch
input = torch.tensor([[.9,.1]])
target = torch.tensor([0])
nll = torch.nn.functional.nll_loss(input, target)
print(nll)

prints

tensor(-0.9000)

System Info

$ python collect_env.py
Collecting environment information...
PyTorch version: 0.4.1
Is debug build: No

Target: x86_64-apple-darwin17.7.0
Thread model: posix
InstalledDir: /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools/usr/bin
$ pip --version
pip 18.0 from /anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pip (python 3.6)

body:
## Issue description

torch.nn.functional.nll_loss returns the negative likelihood instead of the negative _log_ likelihood.

## Code example

```
import torch
input = torch.tensor([[.9,.1]])
target = torch.tensor([0])
nll = torch.nn.functional.nll_loss(input, target)
print(nll)
```
prints
```
tensor(-0.9000)
```

## System Info
```

Collecting environment information...
```
